meanings.definition: Of or relating to the sky or heavens.
meanings.sent1: The stars in the celestial sky shone brightly.
meanings.sent2: The moon is a celestial body that orbits the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The clouds danced in the celestial sky, putting on a show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a celestial light illuminating the room.
meanings.sent5: The celestial beauty of the sunset took my breath away.

meanings.definition: Positioned in or relating to the sky or outer space.
meanings.sent1: The astronauts marveled at the celestial view from space.
meanings.sent2: The satellite was launched into celestial orbit around the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The birds flew high in the celestial sky, feeling weightless.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship soared through the celestial expanse of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The telescope captured images of celestial bodies millions of light-years away.

meanings.definition: A heavenly being or divine being.
meanings.sent1: In some myths, a celestial is said to watch over humans.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a celestial with wings and a halo.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined a celestial granting their wishes.
meanings.sent4: Legends speak of a celestial who guides lost souls to peace.
meanings.sent5: The novel described a celestial descending from the heavens to aid the protagonist.
